website_summaries.verdict: An all-around impressive motherboard from ASUS that handles professional, personal, and gaming tasks well.
pros: Intelligent fan and air-cooling system keeps the board and its components cool during operation
PCIe slots sport heavy bracing to protect components from major damage
cons: Installation and setup can be difficult for first-time PC builders and gamers

customer_reviews.title: x1 slots do not work at all.
customer_reviews.text: The board seemed great untill i tried using the x1 slots, they do not work AT ALL. I tried 3 different raid cards none of them work in the x1 slots only in the x16 slot. *Update* Downgraded back to 0405 and the pcie x1 slots work now. Then after i confirmed it worked with 0405 i upgraded to 0502 and they didnt work, cleared the cmos and now they work? Asus needs to share some focus on this board instead of only on the crosshair..
customer_reviews.author: Jacob S.

customer_reviews.title: Raven Ridge Ready (maybe?)
customer_reviews.text: Mine came "AMD Desktop 2000 [Raven Ridge] Ready" out of the box, which was awesome. (The description doesn't say that yet so they might not all be...) It's working flawlessly with a Ryzen 5 2400G so far.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas H.

customer_reviews.title: I have always purchased ASUS but now i'm questioning their quality
customer_reviews.text: Defective Mic input and Faulty USB ports. Contacted ASUS and they will take the product back for repair at my expense of shipping which is close to $40.00. I asked them if they could refund it after they confirm the product was defective. They declined me and then told me to contact the seller which is Amazon. I expected more for ASUS they have always been a go to brand but my next build will not incorporate any of their products.
customer_reviews.author: TravisLovesLaurie

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with Ryzen 2600 out of the box (See Below)
customer_reviews.text: Beware that this board does not work with the AMD Ryzen 2600 out of the box. Even though seller claims it is compatible it requires a BIOS update. You cannot update the BIOS without a compatible CPU to start with. I spoke to manufacturer and they want me to call AMD and have them send a boot kit at my cost. Cannot recommend this board.
customer_reviews.author: Aric Powell

customer_reviews.title: best b350 out there
customer_reviews.text: this is an amazing b350 board. it got my r5 2600 to 4.35 ghz 1t 1.6 and landed me at number 11 on cpuz top overclocked ryzen 5 2600's. yea yea thats insanly high voltage wtf am i doing.. lol. it also runs my 2600 at 4.1 at 1.3v which is what i use 24/7 which is amazing for b350. if your looking for a great board at a great price you cant go wrong with this one. i promice you will b happy wit it. it looks great and works great cant go wrong
customer_reviews.author: Miranda R.

customer_reviews.title: Great Motherboard
customer_reviews.text: This one smooth running Motherboard. Love the Bios, easy to access and to make changes. I found the default settings have been working just fine. Changing the boot order is the only item to change and was a snap. This Motherboard came with updated Bios to work with the AMD Ryzen 5 2600. One item that set me back a bit was how to mount the fan, instructions were vague on the two existing plastic mounts. When using the AMD Ryzen 5 2600 CPU, the two mounts are removed and the fan screws into the mounting plate on the backside of the motherboard. The 4 existing screws are in tight, so be careful, but they will come out.
customer_reviews.author: Relaxng

customer_reviews.title: Dead on arrival
customer_reviews.text: No signs of life when attempting to power on with a Ryzen 2400G and memory on the QVL. Returned it and got an ASRock AB350M-HDV which has the same system running with zero issues. It looks like these are shipping with a Ryzen 2000 ready sticker on it. Problem could be with the flimsy PCB and how much you have to crank the 24 pin connector if you install the mobo in the case before making that connection. Micro ATX does not have much support there.
customer_reviews.author: Brett Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Can no longer get into bios but maybe a surge issue
customer_reviews.text: Had a power surge shortly after purchasing this mobo. Not sure if that was the cause or not but I can no longer get any video from the motherboard itself. If I try to get into the bios I get a blank screen. I don't see any posting for the mobo itself and just have to wait until Windows boots. I'm not necessarily sure that is a fault of the motherboard but this is the first mobo I've had that has had an issue after a power surge. Other than that, I really like the look of it and it is functional other than the bios issue.
customer_reviews.author: Skye Harney

customer_reviews.title: Easy installation
customer_reviews.text: I previously had an MSI PC Mate B350 motherboard and I found this Asus much easier to install and work on. Hooking up the front panel connectors seemed way easier and frankly all the places where you plug in the cables seemed much more accessible. Had it up and running in a couple of hours (rookie PC builder) and it booted right up 1st time and seems to be running just fine. It's my teenage son's computer and he games heavily on it (Steam) and so far in the first week or so he's had no problems at all.
customer_reviews.author: Grimsteed

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS MOTHERBOARD UNLESS
customer_reviews.text: you have another couple of windows machines laying around to update the BIOS, have the time and patience to deal with ASUS technical support, which is really, really dreadful and about as helpful as herpes, and you don't mind contacting ASUS tech support to get a "loaner" device to upgrade the BIOS on your other computer. Overall, this is the last ASUS board I ever buy and I rate both ASUS' and Amazon's "support" on this issue as worse than terrible - like almost deliberate lying.
customer_reviews.author: Wes

customer_reviews.title: My core2 quad doing similar running apps at 100 percent ...
customer_reviews.text: My core2 quad doing similar running apps at 100 percent now runs on the Asus strix - AM4 1500x reads 24 percent CPU load running the same applications. BTW - Linux Mint runs flawlessly. I've had the board a little while now, about a month and it just gets better. Running 1500x at 3.8 MHz and Corsair Vengence just under 3 GHz with 1.2 volts on the RAM and just slightly higher CPU voltage. Still no issues whatever running Linux Mint like a dream. Almost disappointed there's nothing at all to fix as I'm a bit of a tinkerer and this thing just ran optimally out of the box. Next step Ryzen 2600 and 16 GB RAM upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Chirnside

customer_reviews.title: This board with Ryzen 5 1500x and a GTX 1060 6GB, I play ARK on epic settings (no overclocking)
customer_reviews.text: This is my first build for playing games. I'm not into overclocking, so I needed simple working parts. I can't give you benchmark info, but I can say that I can play most games 1080p on epic and ultra video settings and not have any stuttering. Worse case scenario so far is that I have to play on high instead of ultra or epic (boo hoo). As this had to be a budget build so that I could get my GTX 1060 and at least an R5, I skimped on my case and motherboard, but it worked right out of the box, and updating the bios using a flash drive was straight forward.
customer_reviews.author: EducatedConsumer

customer_reviews.title: Best value for B350 feature sets
customer_reviews.text: I like the on-board audio that this board provides. It does very well with a NVMe drive as well as standard SSD and HDD storage. I like the fact that the system is ready to do mild overclocking on Ryzen processors. It was also compatible with the memory that I wanted. Although it can support multi-GPU setups, the benefits do not outweigh the costs of doing so. I am still a little skittish to try RAID, but maybe a RAID 5 setup when I have more drives.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Cherry

customer_reviews.title: Reliable and easy to install
customer_reviews.text: My husband bought this mother board for our computer rebuild. Great station for the price. He is very particular about his computer parts and did a lot of research before purchasing. Overall, he is very pleased with this part. My husband says that there is a light on the board that continues to blink that is a different color from the rest. My husband is particular about his color scheme, so this off sets it. All in all, it has been reliable and easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: Mackenzie

customer_reviews.title: A failure and a DOA.
customer_reviews.text: First board worked fine for three days, then would not POST. I tested it down to the standoffs, no change, had it replaced. Second board was DOA and wouldn't even power on, again I tested it all the way down to the standoffs with zero success. Yeah, I think I'll try a different board next time around.
customer_reviews.author: Erich Hartmann

customer_reviews.title: Super Motherboard At This Price Point
customer_reviews.text: For this price, this board has a ton of features. USB 3.1 ports, 4-pin PWN fan connectors, plenty of headers for everything you need, support for higher end AMD processors, and a BIOS that is very easy to work with. I had one issue (my fault) where I was trying to use faster RAM than the motherboard supported. The system wouldn't post at all. Tech support was great on diagnosing, I plugged in compatible RAM and it fired right up. My case came with fans that only support the 3-pin DC standard, but they still work with the 4-pin headers on the board. I am super pleased with every aspect of this motherboard.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Menell

customer_reviews.title: Defective CMOS battery
customer_reviews.text: Bought this mobo in Nov 2018. After putting it together, I had trouble running my computer because it didn't know what hard drive to run. After setting it up, it would only remember to run "harddrive #3" If properly shut down the computer. If I force shut it down or have a power outage and reboot the computer, the computer will run BIOS and you have to re-select hard drive #3 again. In order to fix this, you have to replace the CMOS battery. Other than that, this mother board runs perfectly fine for the past 5ish months of having it
customer_reviews.author: Alexis Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Solid motherboard, but not well documented
customer_reviews.text: The board works for what it is, but ASUS documentation is really spotty. In particular, I got burned by a minimally documented issue with the SATA ports and M2 drives (the board disables SATA ports 5 and 6 if you run an NVME drive, which was buried in a footnote and not in the actual part of the manual dealing with M2 drives). This is basic stuff builders need to know in order to put builds together; it needs to be in the actual manual clearly spelled out.
customer_reviews.author: Isaac M

customer_reviews.title: Failed after 4 months
customer_reviews.text: Thought this board was going to be spectacular since it was manufactured by ASUS, but after only 4 month the board took a dump. I found my computer turning on and off repeatedly and wouldn't post. I tested the PS, all good. I took out the CPU, re-thermaled it, no go. I disconnected everything but the power cord and still nothing, kept recycling on and off. Read some threats to find that this is a known issue with this board. Buyer be ware!! Read up on the issues before purchasing. Going to try and get an RMA or a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Sigismonti Jr.

customer_reviews.title: This is the only brand of motherboards you should buy
customer_reviews.text: Both my boyfriend and I have ASUS motherboards. He has the Prime B350-Plus and I have the ROG STRIX B350-F. They are fantastic. I love my STRIX because the RGB light is bright and beautiful. I've always had ASUS laptops and they have lasted for AGES. It was easy to hook up all the components to it. Can't recommend this enough!
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Benson

customer_reviews.title: In a word: Great.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this board for my first home build. Several weeks later no buyers remorse, still happy with this decision. Easy BIOS update via Ethernet connection. Only complaint would be I couldn’t get my RAM beyond 2666MHz (Corsair Vengeance LPX 16GB - CMK16GX4M2B3000C15). Everything I have read since suggest decreasing returns beyond this point anyway. But the product itself has earned my wholehearted recommendation.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: 8 usb ports is a must for me and the 2 RGB headers helped out as well for perfect
customer_reviews.text: This motherboard has everything i wanted. I swapped out from a MSI B350 Arctic Tomahawk. Had issues with my old board with overclocking the ram and cpu but with the Asus it was simple. Set my ram to 3000 and Ryzen 1700 to 3.7ghz with leaving everything else on auto. 8 usb ports is a must for me and the 2 RGB headers helped out as well for perfect colorization
customer_reviews.author: marcmassacre

customer_reviews.title: Great small motherboard and does what it is supposed to
customer_reviews.text: Great small motherboard and does what it is supposed to. Latest bios update makes the interface look better and works with higher speed memory modules. Only issue i have with this is the memory QVL and the low amount of 3200 memory supported.
customer_reviews.author: jaysin

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: Happy overall. Nice board. Beware of the sharp edges on the heat sink. I managed to tear some sleeving on them. RGB is nice touch but as the gpu blocks it completely seem like a wasted effort.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good but not great.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good board so long as you don't want to use 3200Mhz RAM or OC that much. Even using DOCP profiles I cannot maintain factory 3200Mhz RAM speeds on a kit that I know for a fact is stable at 3200Mhz on other boards. Processor OC shows similarly moderate results, so if you're looking for something that can hit 4Ghz on a 1600/1700 and 3200Mhz on RAM, look elsewhere. But if you want a good budget board this is definitely a stable choice.
customer_reviews.author: Rezalas

customer_reviews.title: Working great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Motherboard a few months ago after my current one at the time fried itself. Packaging was quite secure and safe. This one was very simple to install and also is a great value for your money! NO COMPLAINTS and this thing is sexy af. RECOMMEND - CHECKING YOUR BIOS IF YOU HAVE NEWER COMPONENTS
customer_reviews.author: Kalen Hamada

customer_reviews.title: The heat sinks look fantastic and the RGB has worked flawlessly
customer_reviews.text: A dream board to work with.. Everything just works right out of the box. very attractive finish for my work computer.. Just make sure you buy RAM and SSD off of the Factory approved list or you might have problems hitting the advertised speeds and all... I did not overclock with this board so I can not speak to that side of it. But I have had no problems hitting ram speeds or with the general functionality of this board. The heat sinks look fantastic and the RGB has worked flawlessly!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Used it for budget build APU...
customer_reviews.text: This is using ryzen 3 2200G APU. System is rock solid with a mild OC and using 3000 ddr4 16 gigs of RAM. Been on 24/7 for a few months now... hasn't missed a beat and is rock solid. I do have a windowed case and the light show is cool...not too overpowering. Nice and stable.
customer_reviews.author: E. Potter

customer_reviews.title: The board is nice but i have had a lot of random issues
customer_reviews.text: The board is nice but i have had a lot of random issues. Occasionally my PC will just randomly restart, screen will go black and i end up having to do a hard reset by turning off the PSU and please make sure to purchase memory sticks that are listed on the boards QVL. To Asus' credit they have been updating the BIOS frequently so hopefully they will get all the issues figured out. I kept it because i have faith in ASUS Mobo's.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Bordenave

customer_reviews.title: Not so lucky
customer_reviews.text: Having owned boards before I had high hopes for this board. Could not get it to post, memory issues, even purchased new memory still no good. Had to return the board. The 2 stars is due to Asus tech support was very prompt in responding in an effort to resolve the issue but a bad board is a bad board.
customer_reviews.author: Grandpajets

customer_reviews.title: It works for me
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfect out of box with a new ryzen 5 2600 and rtx 2060. 0 issues so far.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful and beautifully priced!
customer_reviews.text: I am loving this board so far! The AURA RGB lighting system is great on both the board itself and external RGB strips. I love being able to configure lighting from software and not with a small janky remote like most systems require. This board is the heart of my recent Ryzen 5 build and I couldn't be happier!
customer_reviews.author: Christian

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: The motherboard I received was faulty. It couldn't get into BIOS but 5% of the time.
customer_reviews.author: S.Fox

customer_reviews.title: Good, except everything is Black on Black on Black on Black.
customer_reviews.text: Only complaint is the nonsense black-everything that this kit had. Next model: any other color for the ports please, hell I'd even take a dark grey if I had to. Please, some contrast! Black screws, black ports, black wires, and why the hell not, a black motherboard. This made assembly quite annoying since I had to keep adjusting a light to plug in *everything*. End result looks fine, but was it worth it? Not really.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: You Will need Ethernet OR a WiFi dongle
customer_reviews.text: It was a great starter board. It didn't say that it doesn't support WiFi so I had to spend an additional $10 on a WiFi dongle. It is very nice to look at and the over all performance an look is great. ( I know 10 dollars isn't much, it was just kind of a let down)
customer_reviews.author: Rae

customer_reviews.title: Worth it, even after a dead one
customer_reviews.text: Number two. First one died. (Everything would seem to power on but wouldn't output video through my GTX 970. Dead PCIe?) Swapped the board and back to normal. Maybe a bad batch, or bad luck. A bit of a bummer, but I do like this board enough to give it a second shot.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander L Grotewohl

customer_reviews.title: I would like to have seen a few more fan headers on ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the MB during the prime day sale with the Ryzen 5 2600 processor & a Samsung 970 pro nvme m.2. The box had a sticker on it that indicated it was Ryzen 2nd generation ready. Put everything together and posted without issue. The version of the bios that it shipped with was 3805. I would like to have seen a few more fan headers on the board, and it wouldn't kill ASUS to include the q-connector kit (for the system panel connector) for every board. Overall, a great board for a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Erik

customer_reviews.title: This board had so many issues. Computer would crash ...
customer_reviews.text: This board had so many issues. Computer would crash all the time. Memory issues and couldn't over-clock. Had to return it for a MSI board which works flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: ATTICUScc04

customer_reviews.title: Great motherboard
customer_reviews.text: This motherboard is working great for my ryzen 1600 and 1070. I have both of them overclocked, and the ryzen cpu is stably overclocked to 3.8ghz on all cores. The bios works really well, much better than MSI IMO, and it's been working perfectly for about 6 months.
customer_reviews.author: Phil from AK

customer_reviews.title: amazing RGB and performance
customer_reviews.text: Asus is the king of Motherboards for a reason the b350f is a feature packed high performance mobo for ryzen chipsets just be sure to update the bios before use.
customer_reviews.author: drykill_23

customer_reviews.title: Bough december 2018, Board isn't ryzen 2000 ready
customer_reviews.text: After reading some comments saying the board came with a bios update that makes this boards support the newer generation amd processors since march of last year I didn't hesitate to go with this model to pair it up with my 2nd gen ryzen CPU. To my surprise as you can tell from the title of this review, I'm now stuck (Outside of the US) with a new computer that can't boot. If you're planning on using this with 2nd generation amd processors, maybe contact amazon first to make sure you'll receive one that comes with the updated BIOS.
customer_reviews.author: Alain Figueroa

customer_reviews.title: Just Awesome.
customer_reviews.text: This mobo is awesome! Looks amazing in my case. Glad i made this purchase. Paired it up with a Ryzen 52600X, Crosair 16gb DDR4 and a Zotac 1060 6gb. You will need to update the Bios or your memory will be stuck at 2100mhz. Super easy to do.
customer_reviews.author: Anile8

customer_reviews.title: super nice MOBO for ryzen amd chip.
customer_reviews.text: Good quality MOBO. Mine came in almost perfect, only small problem i encounter was one of the screw on the bracket where you install the cpu fan, has no thread luckily inwas able to unscrew it.
customer_reviews.author: jose

customer_reviews.title: Nice, motherboard, installed without issues.
customer_reviews.text: Installed R5 1600 with no issues. Fist thing updated bios, then from there no issues. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: W. Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Great B350 MB for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great B350 MB for the price. Installed the Ryzen 1700. Make sure you flash the bios before before changing setting. Also, all memory above 2133 must run with DOCP setting, but not an issue. OC to 3.65 GHz and memory at 2666.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: but the second one is working fantastic as of 8/9/2017
customer_reviews.text: I had to order a replacement as my first board died when I attempted to upgrade the gpu, but the second one is working fantastic as of 8/9/2017. I had a bit of an issue overclocking the ram, but the xocp worked fine until I could figure out the timings for myself. There does seem to be a hard limit to certain things like over clocking a gpu and going higher then 3.85ghz with a ryzen 7, but both of those could be due to hardware limitations. Overall I'm very impressed with this as my first micro atx board.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Hennig

customer_reviews.title: Wasnt real happy with this motherboard when I first bought it
customer_reviews.text: Wasnt real happy with this motherboard when I first bought it. Most of the ASUS software was buggy as hell, didnt work well with other lightservice programs (CorsairLink, and NZXT HUE software). This has been fixed with more recent updates. Overall, its not a bad motherboard for the price. I have found better, but isnt that the way of building PCs. Just be aware that if you put a GPU in the top slot, its going to block the RGB LED on the motherboard, see photos. This is why I moved the GPU to the second slot.
customer_reviews.author: Philip J. Mildren

customer_reviews.title: It is an awesome Motherboard. But the BIG ISSUE is that I ...
customer_reviews.text: It is an awesome Motherboard. But the BIG ISSUE is that I could not install Windows 7 since the OS doesn't support USB 3.0 by default. I had to install windows 10 and so, to buy a new license. I know it has two USB 2.0, but they are disabled just in the moment my Windows 7 starts, I also read similar problems on the internet without any solution. Anyways, it works perfectly on windows 10.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Aura Sync works like a charm and was able to OC my 1600X ...
customer_reviews.text: The freaking bomb sauce! Aura Sync works like a charm and was able to OC my 1600X to 4.1 Ghz at 1.38 volts, stable. 4.2 eludes me, but that seems to be par the course without over volting like a mother. Water cooled with EK P240 kit with extra 120mm radiator.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Zero issues !!!
customer_reviews.text: This was my first ryzen board and I really love it especially when it boots up the first time with no issues. I do highly recommend updating the BIOS to the most recent before you get too involved with other software.
customer_reviews.author: scott's buy

customer_reviews.title: Works great with my Ryzen 7 1700 so far.
customer_reviews.text: Chose this for my first build. Runs great so far. Nice BIOS, RGB works with everything, plenty of fan headers. Love the optical port and improved onboard sound. I'll update this review if it croaks.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Haggerty

customer_reviews.title: Completely broken.
customer_reviews.text: Building my brother a nice rig for christmas and decided to try this motherboard. Was using an SLI setup, and the PCI slot 2 was damaged. It wouldnt read a gpu at all. Had to use the 3rd slot which was a hard fit because a gpu in the 3rd slot completely covers the the bottom of the board and smashes the cables in if you willing to attempt that. The 3rd PCI slot does read SLI so that didnt work. Have returned the board and now my brothers Christmas present will not be ready until the 27th.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn J

customer_reviews.title: good enough
customer_reviews.text: led control by software on windows. bios only on or off. third party software. when runnig fortnite indicates as cheating software. oh well...
customer_reviews.author: Auriski

customer_reviews.title: Works fine with 2700X
customer_reviews.text: Works just fine with a Ryzen 2700X. Say all you want about VRMs or overclocking or whatever, but I've had no issues whatsoever with this board.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Please read the memory spec sheet
customer_reviews.text: I got this board for a budget build and while the board is well made but the supported memory list is woeful. Kind of a pain in the butt trying to get this thing to post. Overall it's a good little board and cheap but well made.
customer_reviews.author: Foamy

customer_reviews.title: great for streaming and gamers1
customer_reviews.text: ive had this over a year and has worked great for me I game and stream a lot and watch movies while im gaming this motherboard has been great
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: The board itself looks very nice and I like the fact that its not overdone ...
customer_reviews.text: I chose this board after some time researching and the reviews for the power delivery circuits. The board itself looks very nice and I like the fact that its not overdone in RGB lighting. Bios is easy to use and I like that is has enough USB ports for peripherals and a VR HMD. Solid choice.
customer_reviews.author: Chris B

customer_reviews.title: Awesome capability in a small package.
customer_reviews.text: I had no need for tech support, so can't speak to that, but this little motherboard is a champion. Will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas B. Willcox

customer_reviews.title: Great motherboard!
customer_reviews.text: After the bios update, this board will handle any 2nd gen Ryzen with ease. Love this board though some better attention to the viability of labels on it would be appreciated. Would have a 5 star if the 470 wasn't out.
customer_reviews.author: randy c.

customer_reviews.title: Sweet looking board
customer_reviews.text: First time building a PC and I went with this board. I wanted a full size ATX board and wanted overclocking capabilities maybe for future use. I have to say I'm really happy with my choice. Manual was simple to understand, looks great, and has good features. Love how I can changing RBG with Aura Sync, very nice touch.
customer_reviews.author: Manny

customer_reviews.title: The best motherboard I've ever had
customer_reviews.text: Easy to setup and install, comes with everything I needed and some extra goodies like stickers and a coaster. Glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Sophie-bear

customer_reviews.title: Great motherboard
customer_reviews.text: This motherboard was an easy install but the most important thing is the setup menus on it are so easy to maneuver around it’s even easy for a noob to mess around and overclock things and it looks awesome very happy with it
customer_reviews.author: dean

customer_reviews.title: Instillation was easy enough, instructions could be slightly clearer as well ...
customer_reviews.text: Instillation was easy enough, instructions could be slightly clearer as well as the error LEDs (RAM, Video, Boot, etc.). Plenty of room for all cables, well laid out. No issues so far.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Schroen

customer_reviews.title: great board.... bad RGB
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in Feb 2018. in just 2 years, the RGB stopped working completely. board still works great though.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Lawson

customer_reviews.title: The performance bests the price.
customer_reviews.text: Came in great packaging. But apparently being shipped it did receive a puncture in the box. But nothing hurt so no problems. All my gear plugged in easily and were all recognize and easy to install on.
customer_reviews.author: Broc Pratt

customer_reviews.title: Great Overclocking and Led Lighting Control
customer_reviews.text: So happy I got this motherboard, over clocks cpu and ram perfect no problems. Love the led lighting and features can really dial in leds.
customer_reviews.author: Skull Crusher Adventures

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 5 months.
customer_reviews.text: Used under light stress, this board stopped working in just under 5 months. Save yourself the time, money and hassle and buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Dead on Arrival (DOA)
customer_reviews.text: Dead on arrival. I tried resetting the cmos, cleaning the socket pin connectors, re-seating the cpu, and cleaning gpu connectors. Nothing. I've never been more dissatisfied in a product
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: ASUS = quality boards, even for a "budget" build!
customer_reviews.text: Used this in a new build for my nephew. Everything's working great! I've been building for a long time, so I was really surprised at all the features this "budget" board offered. Definitely will consider this strongly for future builds.
customer_reviews.author: Switch Box Tech

customer_reviews.title: Worked right out of the box for me and has a bunch of enthusiast grade features on a pretty inexpensive board
customer_reviews.text: I am a big fan of this board. Worked right out of the box for me and has a bunch of enthusiast grade features on a pretty inexpensive board. I am using this with a Ryzen 5 1600 and have it overclocked on this board with no problems. Very glad to pick this thing up.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander James Hodson

customer_reviews.title: Meh..
customer_reviews.text: I want to love this motherboard so much but it keeps hurting me..softly. Everytime I try to overclock my Ryzen 5-1600, (even to 3500mHz) through the bios, the system throttles the processor to 1500mHz. However, I am able to clock the processor at 4100mHz using Ryzen master.
customer_reviews.author: Obie2fly

customer_reviews.title: ASUS ROG STRIX B350-F
customer_reviews.text: The board is great. I am very happy with it. I am no expert, but I know enough to tell you that this board is a good solid choice for the price.
customer_reviews.author: ACTRO

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works great, just it is difficult to setup the first time a ryzen pc. I was able to overclock my 1600x to 3.9Ghz in all cores easy.
customer_reviews.author: Josue Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: The best
customer_reviews.text: I really like this motherboard and it is usually easy to find a used motherboard for about $80. Bios is great and the last board that I got already had the bios update.
customer_reviews.author: BlakeH

customer_reviews.title: Rgb not working
customer_reviews.text: Great motherboard only problem is that my rgb doesn’t connect to ASUS aura but haven’t found solution to problem yet
customer_reviews.author: Holden Morris

customer_reviews.title: Solid Mobo
customer_reviews.text: Easy to update bios. It scans the internet for updates. Drivers were also easy to install. Fan headers layout is a little confusing. Everything else is self explanatory. Good construction, low noise audio jack. Could use a few more USB ports or a usbc port
customer_reviews.author: colleen

customer_reviews.title: It's a fine, fast motherboard
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't take much to be a good motherboard, as long as it doesn't have a manufacturing defect. Just get this one. The rainbow LED effect is a little needless, though.
customer_reviews.author: Fargonaut

customer_reviews.title: Good-looking board
customer_reviews.text: Bricks when using D.O.C.P Profile#1 (memory model F4-3000C15D-32GVR, and yes, it's from the approved vendor list). Only boots when you knock it down to DDR4 2666. No jumpers included so I needed to remove the CMOS battery to get it running again. Also remember to get a fan power splitter if you have more than one chassis fan because there's only one chassis fan connector on this board. Otherwise it's a great-looking board. The lighting on the board is subtle and tasteful. My non-nerd friends were mesmerized by the look of this board and the stock AMD cooler.
customer_reviews.author: J. R. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Very good for gaming
customer_reviews.text: It can a lot of power from graphics cards and power supply and really anything you can connect not to mention that it looks really cool.
customer_reviews.author: Torsten S Rahm

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: This ASUS Motherboard was very easy, easy enough to fit the IO shield. However, you do have to watch when you are connecting the SATA cables. I do suggest you plug in SATA cabling before screwing in the motherboard to your case. due to hard to reach SATA ports on the motherboard. But overall very good product from ASUS.
customer_reviews.author: Damien

customer_reviews.title: Nice board will update
customer_reviews.text: Works fine for what need.. Gave a little problem with bank 2 memory slot but resolved by removing RAM and reinstalling.. Update...used in 2 Ryzen 1600 builds....solid board nice RGB lighting....My son loves it and so do I...had to set ram speed to 2666 was detecting 2133 ....
customer_reviews.author: Joe Holc

customer_reviews.title: Dont post
customer_reviews.text: So I Just need to change my mb that have aura sync, when i finished the change plug in everything it doenst post at all
customer_reviews.author: Jose Alberto

customer_reviews.title: WIcked mobo
customer_reviews.text: I must say this mobo worked right out of the box with my ryzen 2600, Had the desktop 2000 ready.
customer_reviews.author: SJ

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up for me!  Had it running in no time.
customer_reviews.text: Great quality product. Do some research ahead of time. Easy bios set up and a lot of its items were plug and play. Great LED lights on the interior.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Asus continues to make quality motherboards.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Asus motherboard and I will continue to go to Asus for motherboards. Everything about it is outstanding.
customer_reviews.author: Kirkvillian

customer_reviews.title: Gamer's delight.
customer_reviews.text: For gamer's, this thing is the ticket. Great bang for the buck with many features found on more costly boards.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick M.

customer_reviews.title: Nice Board
customer_reviews.text: Fast shipping. Easy install. Needed new case but that was my fault. Runs absolutely beautifully. No issues at all. Installed Samsung EDO 970 SSD in the M.2 slot. Blazingly fast and easy setup.
customer_reviews.author: K. Miskel

customer_reviews.title: Great, except memory speed.
customer_reviews.text: Not good with 16gb+ of memory over 2800mhz despite DOCP. Otherwise, works as expected. Would by again for sub $1000 builds.
customer_reviews.author: Bird

customer_reviews.title: Mobo died after a year!
customer_reviews.text: Mobo DIED 1 week after AMAZON's 1 year warranty window. Going to contact manufacturer asap and update review. Don't want to say planned obsolescence but that's waaay awful timing.
customer_reviews.author: Abby Rocha

customer_reviews.title: Great but don't expect a lightshow
customer_reviews.text: RGB is underwhelming and is hidden by large video cards but otherwise a great MOBO. Too bad this platform has RAM compatibility issues.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Has issues
customer_reviews.text: One of the ram ports does not work. Some of the usb ports cause static shocks that turn off the video card.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for the buck buy
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box perfection. Great LED’s and plenty of expansion space.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Great board don't buy used!
customer_reviews.text: Giving it four stars cause I bought it used which stated the package was damage, that wasn't the case instead 2 of the sata cables where missing, the RGB header cable and cable tie backs, I would of perfered to known that considering I got it cause it came with this stuff. So another buy it new other then that this board is a beast
customer_reviews.author: Joe h.

customer_reviews.title: Best B350
customer_reviews.text: This was the creme de la creme of the B350 crop at the time, overclocks well, fairly stable and lives up to the ROG name in every situation. Solid buy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine with Ryzen 1600 and Corsair Vengeance LPX ram. I did update my bios just to be sure.
customer_reviews.author: Spbeyond

customer_reviews.title: Disable CPB in the bios if you intend to overclock.
customer_reviews.text: Can't be happier with this board. It has intel LAN, 7.1 audio (most budget b350 are 5.1), 2 usb 3.1 ports (most budget b350 has none), very nice uefi, and the vrm is good enough for me to overclock the 1600x to 4ghz at 1.4v. An amazing b350 for the price.
customer_reviews.author: BlackJack

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful motherboard for Ryzen cpus
customer_reviews.text: The most beautiful motherboard Ive ever seen. ASUS is my motherboard for all my builds never had one fail yet
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked as expected
customer_reviews.text: Gave an upgrade to my desktop tower from Amd fx 8320 to Ryzen 7 1700x. the mobo is good quality, and every thing was easy to install. It worked as expected.
customer_reviews.author: GoodBuy

customer_reviews.title: Struggle free for now.
customer_reviews.text: Worked with the Ryzen 3 2200g right out box no touble at all. I'll update if things change.
customer_reviews.author: James Draper

customer_reviews.title: Very nice product!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Every thing plugged in and fired up 1st try. I went with budget build ryzen 3 2200 cpu. Runs my games strong compared to my 13 yr old motherboard and cpu of course i use nothing but asus motherboards with zero problems.
customer_reviews.author: keith

product_meta.title: ASUS ROG STRIX B350-F GAMING AMD Ryzen AM4 DDR4 HDMI DisplayPort M.2 USB 3.1 ATX B350 Motherboard
product_meta.description: Size:ATX| Style:ROG Strix B350-F GamingExperience next-level performance with the ROG STRIX B350-F GAMING, powered by AMD Ryzen AM4 processors. Unlock your system's full potential with 5-Way Optimization featuring SafeSlot and Fan Xpert 4 while personalizing your build with AURA Sync RGB lighting. Integrated NVMe M.2, gigabit LAN and USB 3.1 deliver maximum connectivity speeds.
feature_bullets: Powered by AMD Ryzen AM4, 7th generation Athlon and HD 2000 series processors to maximize connectivity and speed with NVMe M.2, USB 3.1, gigabit LAN, and up to 64GB of DDR4

5-Way Optimization with Auto-Tuning and Fan Xpert 4 automatically tailors overclocking profiles to your unique build for maximum OC performance and dynamic system cooling. Operating System: Windows 10 64-bit

AURA Sync RGB lighting plus additional 4-pin RGB headers provides a nearly endless spectrum of colors with the ability to synchronize effects across an ever-expanding ecosystem of AURA Sync enabled products
Industry-leading 8-channel HD audio with the ROG exclusive SupremeFX S1220 driven by Japanese capacitors

Dual Patent-pending SafeSlots feature an injection molding process that integrates metal framing for a stronger, firmly anchored PCIe slot built for heavyweight GPUs.Form Factor: ATX Form Factor 4.5 x 3.7 inches ( 12 x 9.6 inches )

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars654 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
